section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of necessary hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance at its convenience, without prior notice.
explanation: The initial statement promises continuous operation (24/7, including holidays). However, the exception for maintenance introduces ambiguity. The phrase "at its convenience, without prior notice" gives i-on broad discretion, potentially allowing for frequent or extended maintenance periods that contradict the promise of continuous service. This lack of clarity makes it difficult to determine the acceptable limits of maintenance downtime and could lead to disputes.

section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term.
explanation: The contract initially states a 6-month term with automatic renewal for one-month periods. The phrase "one (1) or more one (1) month periods" is ambiguous. It is unclear whether renewals are limited to a single month at a time, or if multiple one-month extensions can occur consecutively. This ambiguity makes it difficult to determine the length of the contract after the initial term and impacts the notice period required for non-renewal.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees within 30 days of receiving the invoice. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner may result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: While the contract states the monthly fee and a 30-day payment window, it lacks clarity regarding when the invoice is issued. Without specifying when the invoice is sent (e.g., at the beginning of the month, at the end, or on a specific date), the 30-day payment window becomes ambiguous and difficult to enforce. This could lead to disputes over late payments and service interruptions.
